alert.note: Alert for Broome; Chemung; Schuyler; Steuben; Tioga; Tompkins (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 3:19AM EST until February 22 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. The higher end snow and ice accumulations are most likely across elevations above 1400 feet. * WHERE...In New York, Steuben, Schuyler, Chemung, Tompkins, Tioga and Broome counties. In Pennsylvania, Bradford, Susquehanna, Wyoming, Lackawanna and Luzerne counties. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 10 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation starts off as a period of snow, heavy at times midday or early afternoon. The snow is then forecast to change over to sleet and freezing rain after about 5 PM this afternoon. The freezing rain and sleet will change over to all rain by around 10 PM this evening. 1 inch or less of snow and sleet accumulation is expected in the lower elevations of the Wyoming Valley.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.

area.areaDesc: Broome; Chemung; Schuyler; Steuben; Tioga; Tompkins
